alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 13 at 5:35PM MST until July 13 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MST FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 534 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Queen Valley to near La Palma to 9 miles north of Kaka, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than a mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 177 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 135 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 199 and 221. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Apache Junction, Florence, Coolidge, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, Gold Camp, Big Horn, San Tan Valley, Florence Junction, Queen Valley, Superstition Mountains and Olberg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
